message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and radiographic findings suggest ankylosing spondylitis. Indomethacin is a first-line treatment for this condition as it is an anti-inflammatory medication that can reduce pain and inflammation in the joints. Methotrexate and cyclophosphamide are not typically used for ankylosing spondylitis, and bed rest alone is not sufficient treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bilateral sacroiliitis suggests ankylosing spondylitis. Indomethacin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug that is frequently used for the treatment of ankylosing spondylitis. Methotrexate and cyclophosphamide are used for other autoimmune diseases and bed rest is not the appropriate treatment for this condition.

Indomethacin is a recommended therapy for this condition. Methotrexate and cyclophosphamide are more commonly used for other autoimmune disorders. Bed rest is not a recommended treatment for ankylosing spondylitis.

The patient’s symptoms and the radiographic findings suggest ankylosing spondylitis, which can be treated with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like indomethacin. Methotrexate and cyclophosphamide are used for other types of inflammatory arthritis. Bed rest is not recommended for ankylosing spondylitis as it can worsen stiffness and pain.
